items.item_details: Congratulations!! Mr. Reed, Director of Activities, Monica Deleon, A.S.B. President, and all students involved in our Student Activities Program. They have work hard for our school to become a recipient of the California of Directors of Activities/California Association of Student Leaders, Outstanding Student Activities Program Award for the 2007-2008 school year. The award is based on a self study of school activities program in the areas of goal setting, utilization of the CADA Leadership Standards, caring a unique program that services a wide spectrum of the student body, and has a positive impact on the culture and climate of the school. Our school has demonstrated excellence in these areas and is being honored. Â This year’s award is being presented to thirty high schools from California. Over 800 member schools are eligible for this honor. Mr. Reed, Activities Director and Monica De Leon A.S.B. President will be recognized at the (CADA) Calif. Association of Directors of Activities Annual Convention in Reno, February 27th – March 31st. Â On Monday March 31st at the third general session of the (CASL) Student State Conference in San Jose, Ms. Monica De Leon will be presented with a recognition plaque.

items.item_details: TO:			Board of TrusteesFROM:		Bob Nuñez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:	Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:	Adopt Resolution #2007/2008-35 Certifying Results of General Obligation Bond Election Held on February 5, 2008The Board of Trustees of the East Side Union High School District adopted its resolution on September 20, 2007, ordering an election for general obligation bonds to be held in the District on February 5, 2008.Pursuant to Elections Code Section 15400, the Governing Board should accept the Statement of Votes and Certificate of Election Results, and declare the totals to be the final results of the election.  The attach APPENDIX A is the certificate of Elections Results from the Registrar of VotersFINANCIAL IMPACT FUNDING SOURCERECOMMENDATION:It is recommended the Board of Trustees approve Resolution Certifying Results of General Obligation Bond Election Held on February 5, 2008 pursuant to Elections Code Section 15400EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTADOPT RESOLUTION 2007/2008-35 CERTIFYING RESULTS OF GENERAL OBLIGATION BOND ELECTION HELD ON FEBRUARY 5, 2008WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the East Side Union High School District (the “District”) adopted its resolution on September 20, 2007, ordering an election for general obligation bonds (the “Bond Election”) to be held in the District on February 5, 2008; andWHEREAS, the Bond Election was duly held and conducted for the purpose of voting on the proposition of issuing general obligation bonds of the District in the amount of $349,000,000 (the “Bonds”); andWHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the District has received a canvass and statement of results of the election from appropriate officials of Santa Clara County, from which it appears that more than 55% of the votes cast on the proposition were in favor of issuing the Bonds; andWHEREAS, the Board of Trustees is required at this time to certify the election results in accordance with Section 15274 of the Education Code;NOW, THEREFORE, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT DOES HEREBY RESOLVE, DETERMINE AND ORDER AS FOLLOWS:Section 1.  Entry of Results in Board Minutes.  The Board hereby orders that entry be made upon the minutes of this meeting that the ballot measure authorizing the issuance of the Bonds was approved by more than 55% of the votes cast at the Bond Election.Section 2.  Finding of Compliance.   The Board hereby finds and determines that all proceedings of the District in connection with the Bond Election have been held, conducted and accomplished according to law.Section 3.  Delivery of this Resolution.  The Clerk of the Board is hereby requested to deliver a copy of this Resolution to the County Superintendent of Schools with a request that, under Education Code Section 15274, the County Superintendent deliver a copy of this Resolution, including the Certificate of Election Results attached hereto as Appendix A, to the Clerk of the Board Supervisors of Santa Clara County.Section 4.  Effective Date.  This Resolution shall take effect on and after its adoption.* * * * * * * *I hereby certify that the foregoing Resolution was passed and adopted by the Board of Trustees of the East Side Union High School District at a regular meeting thereof duly held on March 20, 2008, by a vote of a majority of its members.Adopted by the following votes:AYES:NOES:ABSENT: _____________________________________Secretary to the Board of Trusteesof the East Side Union High School District

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT  Board Meeting of March 20, 2008	Agenda Item:  8.6   TO:	Board of Trustees	FROM:	Bob Nuñez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:	Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations SUBJECT:	Tentative Proposed Agreement with East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA, 	August 31, 2008 – August 31, 2009; Ratify/Approve Tentative Agreement – 	Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsAttached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA.  The District and the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA reached a tentative agreement on February 8, 2008.  The tentative agreement was ratified by East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA on February 13, 2008.  We are submitting this agreement to the Board for ratification.In addition, provisions of AB1200 require that school districts disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing is being held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.FISCAL IMPACT FUNDING SOURCE As per the attached AB1200 document	VariousRECOMMENDATIONIt is recommended that the Board of Trustees, per compliance with AB1200, ratify the tentative agreement between the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA and the East Side Union High School District.AttachmentsDM:cg

items.item_details: TO:	Board of TrusteesFROM:	Bob NuĂąez, Superintendent	PREPARED BY:	Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:	Approve Provisional Internship Permit Request for Certificated EmployeesPursuant to state mandate, the Governing Board must approve Provisional Internship Permit requests allowing the district to employ and assign teacher(s) or administrator(s) who do not hold appropriate credential authorization.The Provisional Internship Permit (PIP) was created in response to the phasing out of emergency permits and became effective on July 1, 2006.  It allows an employing agency to hire an individual who has not yet met the subject matter competence requirement needed to enter an internship program.  The district is requesting approval of the following Provisional Internship Permits for the 2007-2008 school year.Provisional Intern PermitMARTINOV, JamieSpecial EducationIndependence High SchoolQUACH, ChauSpecial EducationMt. items.item_details: TO:			Board of TrusteesFROM:		Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPARPARED BY:	Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:		Approve Distribution of “Go For It” Scholarship FundsRequest approval to award $94,000.00 in “Go For It” Scholarship Fund to East Side Union High School students.Silicon Valley Community Foundation requires authorization to release and distribute funds upon receiving required documentation of recipients from the school sites.  The funds will be released to the school site school banks.The district in the early 1990’s invested an initial $500,000 in revenues into the “Go For It!” fund and collected several hundred thousand from the private sector to create annual interest revenues to fund scholarships.  Over $90,000 in scholarships is distributed annually to student’s who demonstrate the ability and desire to attend college, but lack the funds.Each of the high schools is given an allocation of funds based on their ratio of seniors per school and the total district senior enrollment as of CBEDS.FISCAL IMPACT FUNDING SOURCE:$94,000	Silicon Valley Community Foundation“Go For It” Scholarship FundRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the distribution of scholarship funds.

items.item_details: TO:	Board of TrusteesFROM:	Bob NuĂąez, Superintendent PREPARED BY:	Dan Moser, Assistant Superintendent of Instructional Services SUBJECT:	Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students  DESCRIPTION: Education Code Section 60851 states that students who take one or both parts of the CAHSEE with a modification and receive the equivalent of a passing score are eligible for the waiver request process.  At the request of the student’s parent or guardian, a school principal must submit to the local school governing board a request for a waiver of the requirement to pass the part(s) of the CAHSEE on which a modification was used and the equivalent of a passing score was earned.  For the local board to waive the CAHSEE requirement, the principal must certify to the local board that the pupil has all of the following:1)	An individualized education program adopted pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act or a plan adopted pursuant to Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 that requires the accommodations or modifications to be provided to the pupil when taking the high school exit examination.2)	Sufficient high school level coursework either satisfactorily completed or in progress in a high school level curriculum sufficient to have attained the skills and knowledge otherwise needed to pass the high school exit examination.3)	An individual score report for the pupil showing that the pupil has received the equivalent of a passing score on the high school exit examination while using a modification that fundamentally alters what the high school exit examination measures as determined by the State Board of Education.The waivers were requested by the school site administration on behalf of the students’ parents.The recommended waivers meet the aforementioned criteria delineated in Education Code Section 60851: Student A	Student BStudent CFISCAL IMPACT 		FUNDING SOURCEN/A				N/A	RECOMMENDATIONIt is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.

That the nature of the title of said owner to said property is that of Owner in fee simple, and the names and addresses of all Owners of said property are:		NAME					ADDRESSEast Side Union High School District		830 North Capitol Avenue							San Jose, CA  95133That the property herein referred to and on which said improvements are located is situated in the County of Santa Clara, State of California, and described as follows:Ticket Booth and Concession Stand Project at James Lick, Oak Grove and Yerba Buena High SchoolsBid #B-19-05-06DSA #01-106826 & 01-107258DATED: March 20, 2008								By: _____________________							Jerry Kurr							Associate Superintendent of							Administration & Business ServicesVERIFICATIONI am Jerry Kurr authorized agent of East Side Union High School District the Owner of the property described in the foregoing notice. The following change order is submitted to the Board of Trustees for approval.1.   Description:	Salvage and reinstall existing lockers to temporary changing portables for school use. Reason:		Requested by Owner  Cost:		$2,877.002.   Description:	Remove abandoned school equipment prior to building interior demolition. Reason:		Requested by Owner Cost:		$2,495.003.   Description:	Install additional temporary railings around roof repair area for trade safety. Reason:		Conditions Warranted  Cost:		$678.004.   Description:	Build new cricket on top of skylight infill. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$222.005.   Description:	Repair roof substrate dry-rot areas. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$30,858.006.   Description:	Remove existing messageboard and replace with new Owner-supplied board. Reason:		Requested by Owner Cost:		$ 2,121.007.   Description:	Replace additional dry-rot damaged interior walls at Offices. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$2,452.008.   Description:	Add framing and finishes to cover existing steel moment beams. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$13,641.009.   Description:	Remove and replace rotted wooden structural post. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$213.0010. Description:	Replace existing notched wall studs at Bathrooms. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$2,464.0011. Description:	Replace rotted plywood at rooftop steel moment beams. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$23,939.0012. Description:	Revise existing concrete curbs at Boys locker area. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$4,348.00 13. Description:	Replace rotted wood at Gym exit door thresholds. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$650.0014. Description:	Add hand dryer and revise soap dispensers. Reason:		Requested by Owner  Cost:		$1,557.0015. Description:	Furr existing walls for ADA showers. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$2,788.0016. Description:	Add soffits at all new exterior canopies. Reason:		Requested by Owner  Cost:		$18,955.0017. Description:	Add additional angle iron for exterior canopy support. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$1,197.0018. Description:	Add access door for additional above-ceiling heat detector. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$198.0019. Description:	Replace rotted wall infill area at Locker area. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$435.0020. Description:	Modify casework in Coaches’ Office to accommodate lockers. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$136.0021. Description:	Replace existing broken tree grate at Bldg. 1300. Reason:		Requested by Owner Cost:		$1,128.0022. Description:	Revise existing concrete locker curbs at Girls locker area. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$1,030.0023. Description:	Replace existing damaged sheetrock at Pool Storage Room. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$1,552.0024. Description:	Add steel handrails at new drinking fountain. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$1,735.0025. Description:	Replace existing rotted building exterior soffit areas. Reason:		Requested by Owner Cost:		$6,129.0026. Description:	Add additional fire-rated plywood for temporary FA system. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$317.0027. Description:	Furr bathroom wall to accommodate existing pipe penetrations. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$373.0028. Description:	Revise exit doors from Gym to Pool. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$3,957.0029. Description:	Level existing floor at Storage Room. Reason:		Unforeseen Condition Cost:		$3,203.0030. Description:	Add full-height plumbing chase at Boys locker area to cover existing pipe openings. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$1,024.0031. Description:	Change soap dishes to soap dispensers. Reason:		Requested by Owner  Cost:		$245.0032. Description:	Caulk and seal additional exterior roof drain penetrations. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$412.0033. Description:	Install temporary wooden exterior doors for student/staff access. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$778.0034. Description:	Change roof hatch railing to match existing roof hatch design. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$1,991.0035. Description:	Additional tile work around changed soap dispensers and trash receptacles. Reason:		Conditions Warranted Cost:		$958.0036. Description:	Negotiated from contract.
